text: that's a deadly cone snail coming up on
the right and the little fellow is a
jumping snail look at it go
the snail increases its oxygen use up to
six times to make those leaps and
Norwegian and Australian researchers
wanted to know how the snail would do in
the warmer more acid seas that are
predicted because of climate change
scientists think those conditions could
damage coral reefs where these and other
snails live they needed to make the
little snails jump which they do when
they smell a nearby predator like a cone
snip so the researchers collected Oda
cone snail then they added it to a
chamber called a respirometer with a
jumping snail inside they recorded the
jumps and monitored the oxygen taken up
from the water the snails did great no
matter whether the water was warm or
acid or both that's good news even if
warmer seas could affect many other
aspects of snail life
